definition:
The ** function, $UNL$, is defined by
$$UNL(c)=\int_{c}^{\infty}(t-c)f(t)dt$$ where $c$ is a constant and
$f(.)$ is the normal probability distribution function.\
An alternative computational formula for $UNL$ is the following:
$$UNL(z)=f(z)-z(1-F(z))$$ where $f(.)$ and $F(.)$ are the probability
distribution function and cumulative distribution function for Standard
Normal Distribution respectively.\
**Remark.** This function has an extensive use in Risk Analysis and the
Theory of Blackjack.
